communications.subject: Public Records Requests R000001-020722, R000175-111622, R000176-111622 and R000177-111622
communications.communication:
[cid:image002.png@01D8FA93.8D4AB690]

November 17, 2022

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 120953
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Public Records Requests R000001-020722,  and New Requests

To Whom It May Concern:

"On November 4, 2021 the Richland School District received your first records request. Your request was sent from the e-mail address 120953-42737343@requests.muckrock.com.  Your request sought the following records:

…all Public Records Requests received by Richland School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

 

On November 8th and 9th, the District sent you two requests for clarification.  Then on November 15, the District e-mailed you.  The body of the District’s e-mail is as follows:

This District has assigned your request with the number 1142021MR for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when corresponding about this request.

Since receiving your request, I have sent at least two requests for clarification to your group and have not heard back.  I corresponded using the portal specific to the Richland School District and assigned by your group. I have not heard back from you.

I am seeking clarification of your very large records request so that the District can provide you with an adequate response.  Is there a staff member that I can speak to for this clarification?  Understanding that you are on the other side of the country, is there a good day and time for me to call?

 

Also on November 15th, you provided an initial clarification.  That same day the District acknowledged your clarification.  The District’s response is as follows:

I understand your request to be for a complete electronic copy of all public records requests received by the Richland School District #400 including the District’s responses for the years 2021-2021.

What I need clarification on is are you requesting all correspondence not just the initial request and the District’s response as there are time like this, that the District asks for clarification.  Further, there are requests that are abandoned.  By that I mean, the Requestor does not clarify or does not come to retrieve the responsive records.

Additionally, are you including requests for video in your request?  If so, the District will need to give third parties adequate notice of your request and the opportunity to seek an injunction.

I would prefer to speak over the phone with the member from your team who is making this request so that we can use our time more efficiently in responding to your request.  Please feel free to contact me directly.

 

You responded on November 16th by stating that your request was for copies of any public records requests received by the District and any responses to these requests by the District, including abandoned requests and requests for video. You also acknowledged the District’s need to give third-party notice.

 

On November 22, the District informed you that it was in the process of compiling a list of individuals who the District would need to provide third-party notice to and their contact information.  The District notified you that it was beginning the process of reviewing the responsive records to determine if there were any other necessary redactions. 

 

Based on the complexity of your request, the need to provide third party notice, and the need to carefully review the records for redactions, the District informed you it estimated it would take fourteen months to fully respond to your request. The District informed you that it would be providing the responsive records to you in installments.

 

The District also noted that it was in the process of updating its public records policy.  Part of that policy update related to fees associated with processing and answering records request. 

 

Starting on November 23rd, the District began received a large number of phone calls and e-mails from the individuals who had received the third-party notices.  Most individuals were concerned with who had requested the information and how the records would be used.

 

In a letter to you on December 1st the District asked that you complete a commercial purposes declaration.  This declaration clearly states that you are not seeking lists of employees and their disclosable information for commercial purposes.

 

On December 6th, the District received notice from you that you were neither seeking records for commercial purposes nor were you requesting any production of responsive documents that required a commercial purposes declaration. 

 

The District continued to receive considerable communications from third parties it had provided notice to regarding your request. Also, the District was reviewing the responsive records to make sure they included all necessary redactions and contained a redaction log.

 

The District e-mailed you installments to your records request by e-mail on the following dates:

January 3, 2022

February 3, 2022

February 3, 2022

February 4, 2022

 

On February 22nd, the District notified you that it was migrating to the GovQA platform to received, process and release all public records requests.  One of the many reasons for this migration is that the District can release responsive files that are significantly larger than what the District’s e-mail system can accommodate.  This allows for records to be release quicker.

 

On March 3rd, you notified the District that while the District was free to use the GovQA platform, you as a Requestor were under no obligation to use the platform. Further you started, “… as such I respectfully refuse.”  Further you wrote e-mailed the District:

The District is directed to provide the requested public records via email or direct no-password, no registration, internet file sharing link. If this is not possible, then responsive records my be provided via US MAIL.

US MAIL ADDRESS:

MuckRock
PRR: N000395-110421
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144

On March 17th, the District e-mailed you the following response:

As you know the District has been working to provide your agency with all responsive records.  Since starting to answer your request the District has begun using the GovQA portal/platform to assist the District in tracking and answering public records requests.  One of the reasons the District made this change is that prior to using GovQA, the District was limited in the size of the file it could send requestors.  GovQA does not have the limitations that the District’s e-mail server has.

Understanding that you are requesting the District to accommodate your request not to use GovQA, the District proposes that it start sending your group thumb drives that contain the responsive records.  The downside to this is that the thumb drives and postage will cost money.  Your group would be responsible for these fees.  Whereas if the District continued to answer your request using GovQA the District would not charge you a fee.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  The District has been inundated with public records request for the past several weeks, but we are committed to providing you with regular installments.

 

You acknowledged the District’s e-mail. You again said you would accept response records via US mail and again provided your mailing address in Sumerville, MA.

On March 17th, the District provided you with the following correspondence:

Dear MuckRock,

Richland School District received a public information request from you on November 04, 2021 and it is being processed in accordance with Chapter 42.56 RCW, the Washington State Public Records Act.

The District assigned your request with the reference number R000001-020722 for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when communicating about your request.

You requested the following records:

“all public records requests received by the District from November 14, 2011 through November 14, 2021. This includes the initial request, all responsive records from the District, and any redaction logs. Further your request also includes abandoned requests and requests for video records. Excluding list of names seeming for commercial purposes”

As you know the District has been working to provide your agency with all responsive records.  Since starting to answer your request the District has began using the GovQA portal/platform to assist the District in tracking and answering public records requests.  One of the reasons the District made this change is that prior to using GovQA, the District was limited in the size of the file it could send requestors.  GovQA does not have the limitations that the District’s e-mail server has.

Understanding that you are requesting the District to accommodate your request not to use GovQA, the District proposes that it start sending your group thumb drives that contain the responsive records.  The down side to this is that the thumb drives and postage will cost money.  Your group would be responsible for these fees.  Whereas if the District continued to answer your request using GovQA the District would not charge you a fee.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  The District has been inundated with public records request for the past several weeks, but we are committed to providing you with regular installments.

If you have any questions, please reply to this email. Thank you for your attention.

April 1st, 2022 – the District mailed you a thumb drive that contained 240 files of responsive records.  It also contained a bill for $36.95. This was sent to your mailing address.  The address the District used was:

MuckRock
PRR: N000395-110421
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144

 

On May 4th the District communicated to you the following:

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2021, Reference # R000001-020722.

Dear MuckRock,

We have not received your payment on invoice number INV22-R000001-1 for Public Records requested by you on November 04, 2021 with Request Number R000001-020722.  

Please see attached or login to the Public Records Request Center to view details.

You can make a check or money order payable to: Richland School District and mail to:

Attn: Nayomi Munguia
6972 Keene Road
West Richland WA 99353

Sincerely,  

Galt Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer
Legal

On September 20, 2022, the District sent to you a thumb drive to replace the two that you reported that you had not received.  There was no charge or fee for this as the last two that we have sent to you, have not been received by your organization.

 

The District is currently loading another installment of responsive record to a thumb drive and will mail it to you by the end of the week. The District will make sure this thumb drive is sent to your new address.

 

Over the past few days, the District has received several new requests from you.  On November 14, 2022, the District received the following public records request from you:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2021. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2021 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2021.

3. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2020. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

4. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2020 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2020.

5. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2019. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

6. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2019 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2019.

The District acknowledges receiving your request.  The District has assigned this request the number R000176-111622. Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.    

Then on November 15, 2022, the District received another records request from you.  In this request you sought:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2019 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2019.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSRIPTS in the year 2019 can be excluded from this request.

The District has assigned this request the number R000175-111622.  Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.    

Today, the District received the following request from you:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

The District acknowledges receiving this request.  The District has assigned it the number R000177-111622.  Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.

 

Again, the District is currently working on providing you with all responsive records to your original request. Richland School District Policy 4040 – Public Records Request provides in part, “When the same requester simultaneously submits multiple, separate requests or makes one or more additional requests when previous requests are open, the District may queue the requests in the order in which they were received. The District is not required to work on an additional request until the initial requests are completed and closed. Requesters are responsible for informing the Public Records Officer if they want to reprioritize the fulfillment of their requests.”

 

Therefore the District will answer your requests in the order it received them. If you want to prioritize your requests, please do so and let the District know which request you want the District to work on.

 

Unless you reprioritize the records requests, the District will continue to provide you with all responsive records to request #R000001-020722.  Within twenty working days after the District completes request # R000001-020722, it will provide you with the first installment of responsive records to request #R000175-111622. Then within twenty workings days after the District provides you with all responsive records to request ##R000175-111622, the District will provide you with the first installment of the responsive records to request #R000176-111622. And within twenty working days following completing request ##R000176-111622,the District will provide you with the first installment of request #R000177-111622. 

 

Please let me know if I misunderstood your request in any way or if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely,

 

 

Galt L. Pettett

Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian

Richland School District #400

6972 Keene Road

West Richland, WA  99353

galt.pettett@rsd.edu

(509)967-6009"

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon:

I would like to start off as stating I am truly sorry for any frustration I have caused you. I take great pride in providing excellent services to Requestors. I am in no way trying to frustrate you or not comply with the Washington State Public Records Act.

In 2021, the Richland School District received a records request from an e-mail address containing “muckrock” in it.  In that request, the Requestor sought several years of records requests and the District’s response to those records request.  The District has been answer this original request be sending installments to the Boston address below.

Then in November, your request and others were received by the District from an e-mail address with “muckrock” in it.  Since these requests were all from “muckrock”, the District presumed they were all from the same organization.

Are there different employees of Muckrock making different requests?  Again, I truly want to provide you with the records you want and do not want to frustrate you, but maybe I don’t understand the Muckrock organization.

Any insight you can provide would be appreciated.

Thank you,

Galt Pettett

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2019) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2019
communications.communication:
Counselor, I don't believe you are "truly" anything, but you requested insight - OK I'll bite.

First, you have not managed to frustrate, only to offend.

I would caution you in taking any pride in your public records responses, as any reasonable person would find it obvious your feigned obtuse communication constructs are designed only to subvert or "frustrate" public records act requests in violation of RCW 42.56. 

You wrote:

"in November, your request and others were received by the District from an e-mail address with “muckrock” in it. Since these requests were all from “muckrock”, the District presumed they were all from the same organization."


When you are copied on an email from Dr. Shelley Redinger - Superintendent Richland School District from Dr. Redinger's "@rsd.edu" email address, including Nancy.Mayer@rsd.edu (Nancy Mayer - Executive Assistant to Superintendent and School Board) Nayomi.Munguia@rsd.edu (Nayomi Munguia - Records Specialist), and Tim.Praino@rsd.edu (Tim Praino - Executive Director of Human Resources) do you believe these are all the same person because each email address ends in @rsd.edu? 

How about the wide world of @gmail.com? One great big "organization?" All the same "person?"

You went to law school right? Gonzaga University, J.D., 1998? Washington State Bar Association (WSBA) #28996 (attachment). I suspect you are a competent guy. This entire obtuse "what is an email?" exercise is a stain on your credibility.

You wrote:

"Are there different employees of Muckrock making different requests? Again, I truly want to provide you with the records you want and do not want to frustrate you, but maybe I don’t understand the Muckrock organization."

I would direct you to the text at the bottom of EVERY request passed through the MUCKROCK website portal on behalf of public records requestors, it was included in my 11-15-22 request and it's real clear:

"PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable."

To my knowledge, no employee of Muckrock has ever made a single public records request of the Richland School District. I doubt they ever will.

You can however count on the growing plethora of unhappy citizens of Richland, Washington as well as the parents of kids in the Richland School District to request public records from your agency to better understand the questionable decisions and choices that have been made by Richland School District employees and School Board members concerning public money and public education in their community. 

I have nothing to do with the MUCKROCK organization other than to use their service to make a public records request.

I am a private citizen of the State of Washington. 

"RCW 42.56.030 - Construction.

The people of this state do not yield their sovereignty to the agencies that serve them. The people, in delegating authority, do not give their public servants the right to decide what is good for the people to know and what is not good for them to know. The people insist on remaining informed so that they may maintain control over the instruments that they have created. This chapter shall be liberally construed and its exemptions narrowly construed to promote this public policy and to assure that the public interest will be fully protected."

I hope this provides requested "insight." Frankly, I find this banal back and forth to be a complete waste of time. 

I suggest your public agency work as directed with all due diligence and haste per the revised code of Washington to produce the identified records requested. Fail not at your peril, under penalty of law.

Thank you.

Hello,

Your invoice is off. If you are providing files via flash drive you cant double charge for "electronic delivery to the cloud." Its either flash drive or CD + Postage or Electronic delivery to the cloud, but not both. 

Payment for $14.10 (-3.00) = $11.10.

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R000001-020722
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 Good Afternoon: The District is in the process of mailing you the next installment of records that are responsive to your records request.  Previously you directed the District that you do not wish to use the District’s third-party public records platform (GovQA). Since that time, the District has been mailing you thumb drives containing files of responsive records. 
There have been some questions about the fees the District charges related to public records request.  The District’s policy and procedure can be found that the following links: https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577 
The District Procedure 4040, states that the District charges the actual costs of mailing to requestors.  Further it also provides: c. Cost for Electronic Records. The cost for providing electronic records is as follows: 1. Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of District equipment to scan the records; 2. Five cents per each four electronic files or attachment uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery; 3. Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of District equipment to send the records electronically; and 4. The actual cost of any digital storage media or device (flash drive) provided by the District, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge. 
These fees are also reflected in RCW 42.56.120(2)(a)-(c) which states, “ (2)(a) Agency charges for actual costs may only be imposed in accordance with the costs established and published by the agency pursuant to RCW (7), and in accordance with the statement of factors and manner used to determine the actual costs. In no event may an agency charge a per page cost greater than the actual cost as established and published by the agency. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=beG9tVySwXbad3mmOCy84qmUPBQ7Ku4kvGvehz4mVc3orb1tcuIDFwVZLcEW-2FrXmsmOsl31WIYLFoxtooTTJGQ-3D-3Dci88_fgpmpHENYoSnFGF-2BZuDhRhiP5uq-2BvbjZoEFYojh8X1vBHjx2IvTZX78yoPz7Ldl-2FDxAxCXfuF5eClgYDhElEDs8YO8bwFGJdSsGE8-2FiNy1Nxaacq7C0ldr3Q0lQr-2FJGMILMridl4xGmFpFWh3n5DanVtN0DYKcxHo-2FckhM-2Fcff4AMVSpag5BA32StgwttZzp-2FD15i2PibBNFgkmOuEotfaCuRJkVk0tpX4n91GwDej8-3D) 42.56.070 (b) An agency need not calculate the actual costs it charges for providing public records if it has rules or regulations declaring the reasons doing so would be unduly burdensome. To the extent the agency has not determined the actual costs of copying public records, the agency may not charge in excess of: (i) Fifteen cents per page for photocopies of public records, printed copies of electronic public records when requested by the person requesting records, or for the use of agency equipment to photocopy public records; (ii) Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of agency equipment to scan the records; (iii) Five cents per each four electronic files or attachment uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery; and (iv) Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of agency equipment to send the records electronically. The agency shall take reasonable steps to provide the records in the most efficient manner available to the agency in its normal operations; and (v) The actual cost of any digital storage media or device provided by the agency, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge. (c) The charges in (b) of this subsection may be combined to the extent that more than one type of charge applies to copies produced in response to a particular request 
The District will continue to produce responsive records. The District estimates it will be mailing you the next installment of responsive records in the next five working days. 
If you have any questions or if I have misunderstood your request in any way, please let me know, 
Galt L. Pettett Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian Richland School District #400 6972 Keene Road West Richland, WA  99353 galt.pettett@rsd.edu (509)967-6009

communications.subject: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2021, Reference # R000001-020722
communications.communication:
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2021, Reference # R000001-020722


Dear MuckRock MuckRock News,
Richland School District received a public information request from you on November 04, 2021 and it is being processed in accordance with Chapter 42.56 RCW, the Washington State Public Records Act.
The District assigned your request with the reference number R000001-020722 for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when communicating about your request.
You requested the following records:
     “all public records requests received by the District from November 14, 2011 through November 14, 2021. This includes the initial request, all responsive records from the District, and any redaction logs. Further your request also includes abandoned requests and requests for video records. Excluding list of names seeming for commercial purposes”
There are currently 3 invoices past due on this account.
Invoice No. 1 was sent on 4/6/2022. No payment was received and a Past Due Invoice Letter was sent on 5/4/2022. The past due balance is $17.00 for Invoice No. 1.
Per communication on 6/28/2022, the FedEx shipping charges will be waived as a one-time courtesy.
Invoice No. 2 was sent on 7/6/2022. No payment was received and a Past Due Invoice Letter was sent on 8/3/2022. The past due balance is $16.25 for Invoice No. 2.
Invoice No. 3 was sent on 8/18/2022. No payment was received and a Past Due Invoice Letter was sent on 9/15/2022. The past due balance is $14.75 for Invoice No. 3.
​The combined past due balance is $48.00.
​
Per the District's Fee Schedule, "Payment of fees is required prior to release of records unless other arrangements have been made." Also, per the District's Fee Schedule, "If payment arrangements are not made within 30 calendar days of notice that records are available, the entire request may be deemed abandoned and closed."
Please see our policy and procedures for our fee schedule https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820578  and  https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577
​
​
I've attached the 3 invoices for your convenience.
[cid:image001.png@01D93A19.84D38B70]
​
[cid:image002.png@01D93A19.84D38B70]
​
[cid:image003.png@01D93A19.84D38B70]
If you have any questions, please reply to this email. Thank you for your attention.
Sincerely,
Kelsey Greenough
Records Specialist


Kelsey Greenough
Records Specialist

RE: Public Records Request of November 16, 2022, Reference # R000175-111622

Dear MuckRock MuckRock News,

Richland School District received a public records request from you on November 16, 2022. You requested the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2019 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2019.
Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSRIPTS in the year 2019 can be excluded from this request.

Richland School District has identified and located records responsive to your request.  An installment to your public records request is now available.  Please log in to the Public Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records.

Public Records Request - R000175-111622<https://rsdwa.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=332&coid=7BFE0C48206CDD>

Beginning December 1, 2022 the District will be charging for all public records requests.  Please see our policy and procedures for our fee schedule https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820578  and  https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577

If I have misunderstood your request in any way or you have any questions, please reply to this email.

Sincerely,

Kelsey Greenough

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #R000001-020722
communications.communication:
3-05-23

via email to Kelsey.greenough@psd.edu

Please let us know if this request is fulfilled in its entirety as it is unclear whether the flash drive documents are duplicates of what had previously been sent. 

Here is another copy of the original public records request I am inquiring about:


Richland School District
Washington Public Records Act Office
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA 99353

November 15, 2022

RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2019) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2019

Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2019 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2019.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSRIPTS in the year 2019 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires

title: Arizona DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mercy Loyo

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #R013318-121522
communications.communication:
Hi, 

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it. 

I noticed that the records you sent over only have room and board fees, but not medical costs charged to those incarcerated in your facilities. Department Order 1101, Section 2 outlines that those incarcerated are charged a health care fee and states that "The Chief Financial Officer shall collect monthly statistics relating to health care fees assessed to inmates (including fees collected and fees debited) and prepare a quarterly report to the ADC Assistant Director for Health Services Contract Monitoring Bureau, due by the 10th workday following the end of the quarter."

I would like to request all reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the health care fees assessed to those incarcerated in Arizona DOC facilities or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding health care fees, including the number of individuals charged and the total amount of health care fees imposed in FY2021.

Sincerely, 
Mercy Loyo

title: List of all USGS owned unmanned aircraft systems

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: List of all USGS owned unmanned aircraft systems
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all unmanned aircraft systems, sometimes known as drones, owned by the department. I ask that the make, model, year and unique identifier of each craft be included, as well as any other data tracked by your agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

A list of all unmanned aircraft systems, sometimes known as drones, owned by the department. I ask that the make, model, year and unique identifier of each craft be included, as well as any other data tracked by your agency. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ben Welsh

title: Earl Brian companies (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Earl Brian companies (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

files relating to or mentioning the following companies:

Infotechnology
Biotech Capital
Biotech
Financial News Network
United Press International

Please include but do not limit the response to materials relating to Earl Brian's June, 1993 settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission on charges of inflating Financial News Network's revenues by millions of dollars.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the Internet Archive and MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: FOIPA # 1416856-000
communications.communication:
Good Morning Ms. Best ,

We're contacting you about the FOIPA request made for records concerning Financial News Network.  The FBI located approximately 7,015 pages potentially responsive to your request.  Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.  A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.  

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, we would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  If you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

The current average time to complete a large track request is approximately 56 months. 

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  If you reduce the size, you can request the additional records with a new FOIA request upon completion of this one.

We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-4894.  We appreciate your patience and hope to hear from you soon.


Sincerely,



Negotiation Team
FOIA Support Unit
FBI Information Management Division
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov
540-868-4894

We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-4894.  We thank you for your time and attention to this inquiry.

title: DEI-related policies

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: DEI-related policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any College of Arts & Sciences policies or guidance related to any mechanism for reporting bias incidents
2. Any College of Nursing policies or guidance related to any system for reporting of DEI complaints or investigation of such complaints
3. Any College of Law bylaws relating to competence in diversity and inclusion
4. Any College of Law policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty applicants submit a diversity or DEI statement
5. Any College of Law policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty report on individual efforts to address diversity, equity, and inclusion in teaching, scholarship and/or service as part of faculty performance evaluations
6. Any College of Law policy or guidance for assessing curriculum or individual courses for the inclusion of intercultural perspectives and issues related to social justice, equity, and the elimination of bias in teaching legal doctrine, policy, practice, and theory
7. Any College of Law course evaluation templates used by students to evaluate faculty members’ teaching performance
8 Any College of Communication and Information policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty applicants submit a DEI statement
9. Any College of Communication and Information policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty include a diversity statement on their course syllabi
10. Any College of Communication and Information policy mandating participation in providing DEI and cultural competency content in courses
11. Any College of Social Work policy or process for systematic review of course syllabi to ensure continuity of intercultural perspectives in all programs
12. Any College of Social Work policy or process for reviewing and revising course syllabi to ensure inclusive teaching content
13. Any College of Social Work retention, promotion, or tenure procedures
14. Any College of Architecture + Design policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty applicants submit a statement on diversity, equity and inclusion or assessment of DEI in faculty teaching reviews and evaluations
15. Any College of Architecture + Design course evaluation template that includes a “diversity sector”
16. The College of Education, Health, and Human Sciences Inclusive Teaching Toolbox
17. Any College of Education, Health, and Human Sciences policy concerning individual syllabus review
18. Any College of Education, Health, and Human Sciences policy policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty develop and demonstrate DEI skill sets and dispositions in curriculum and instruction, or incorporate DEI content into courses
19. Any Any College of Education, Health, and Human Sciences course evaluation template used by students to evaluate faculty members’ teaching performance that includes a domain on DEI perspectives or dispositions
20. Any Tickle College of Engineering policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty applicants include a diversity and inclusion statement with their application
21. Any Tickle College of Engineering policy or guidance relating to consideration of DEI work in annual performance reviews or promotion and tenure recommendations
22. Any College of Veterinary Medicine policy or guidance relating to any requirement that faculty include a DEI statement on their course syllabi or Canvas website

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aaron Terr.

communications.subject: UTS-224-2022 - Pre-payment required
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover, documents that may be responsive to your request have been identified. 
  
 The Tennessee Public Records Act allows the University to charge for the labor involved in gathering and producing documents, and to request a prepayment of fifty (50) percent of the estimated labor charge, prior to beginning the process. 
  
 The University estimates the labor cost to search for and gather the requested documents is $1,343.93. 
  
 The Tennessee Public Records Act stipulates that the first hour of labor be provided at no charge, so the adjusted labor estimate for this request is $1,166.46. 
  
 In order to proceed, you will need to pay $583.23, which is fifty percent of the adjusted estimate. 
  
 Once payment is received, the University will begin gathering the documents, and will advise you when they are ready. 
  
 The actual labor that was expended in the request then will be calculated, and you will be notified of the remaining labor cost. 
  
 Payment can be made with a personal check made payable to “The University of Tennessee System.” 
  
 Our address is:
UT System Division of Communications and Marketing
505 Summer Place
UT Tower #1248C
Knoxville, TN 37902 
  
 Please advise how you wish to proceed. 
  
 Sincerely, 
  
 Charles Primm
Public Records Request Coordinator
UT System Administration
865-974-5180

Thank you.

 Response: This request is denied on the basis there are no such records. 
  
 6. Any College of Law policy or guidance for assessing curriculum or individual courses for the inclusion of intercultural perspectives and issues related to social justice, equity, and the elimination of bias in teaching legal doctrine, policy, practice, and theory

 Please also see documents numbered UT-3–UT-5, from the American Bar Association accreditation standards.

 8. Any College of Communication and Information policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty applicants submit a DEI statement 
  
 Response: This request is denied on the basis there are no such records. 
  
 9. Any College of Communication and Information policy or guidance concerning any requirement that faculty include a diversity statement on their course syllabi 
  
 Response: This request is denied on the basis there are no such records.

title: Georgia Opens Records Request: Criminal Records and Release Dates (Atlanta) (Atlanta Police Department)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia Opens Records Request: Criminal Records and Release Dates (Atlanta) (Atlanta Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the current criminal records of individuals arrested, jailed, or imprisoned that have been released from Atlanta City Detention Center within the previous year if available to the public. This request includes publicly available biographical information of the individuals, the contact information of the individual, the duration of incarceration, the area where the individual was released, or other related information included in the surveillance of formerly incarcerated citizens. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
The Just Data Lab

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Holocaust Survey (North Colonie Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Survey (North Colonie Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law.

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted since August 10, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Peekskill School District Service Contract Agreements

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Peekskill School District Service Contract Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pertaining to service contract agreements maintained by Peekskill City School District over the last 2 years. Specifically, I am requesting the following information:

Any service contract agreements entered into by Peekskill City School District over the last 2 years, including contracts with vendors for services such as custodial, transportation, technology, and other relevant services.

Any amendments or modifications made to service contract agreements entered into by Peekskill City School District over the last 2 years.

Any records related to the bidding process or procurement of service contracts entered into by Peekskill City School District over the last 2 years.

Please include any and all records, including but not limited to contracts, amendments, modifications, bid documents, and any other relevant documents related to service contract agreements entered into by Peekskill City School District over the last 2 years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FLIR THERMAL CAMERAS (Sacramento Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FLIR THERMAL CAMERAS (Sacramento Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Thermal Cameras (FLIR) owned by this department or agency. Please specify if the equipment is hand-held, pole-mounted or in used in conjunction with aircraft.

 - Number, if any, of Thermal Cameras (FLIR) available for use by this department or agency via collaborative agreements that were utilized within the period encompassing this request. Please provide the name of the department or agency that made FLIR devices available to this department or agency for use.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS.


Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

title: Ohio DRC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio DRC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

communications.subject: Re: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio DRC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
Hello,
Please see the attached in response to your records request.


  *   Med 001 is the co-pay and Med 003 is the $3 fee when an emergency appointment is requested but it was determined no emergency existed.


  *   RIB yes is when an incarcerated person acknowledges they are in agreement with the RIB finding.


  *   RIB no is when they do not willingly sign a cash slip and the debt is paid back over time as policy outlines.

Names and numbers of the incarcerated persons have been removed (5120.21 (f)) and limited redactions to case numbers in the medical copay table to protect medical information (R.C. 149.43(A)(1)(a)).

Thank you.
JoEllen Smith


Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction
Ohio Open Records Law Office
770 West Broad Street
Columbus, OH 43222

December 21, 2022

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio DRC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
Dear JoEllen Smith, 

Thank you for your response to my request. The documents you provided for the medical fees were very helpful, but none of these seems to speak to room and board fees. The RIB charges seem to only cover restitution fees. 

If possible could you send over documents specific to room & board cost or fees?

Thank you in advance, 
Elijah Salisbury

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio DRC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
Hello,
Thank you for your email. Ohio does not have room and board fees.
Thank you.
JoEllen Smith

title: FOIL Request for Information Regarding Threatening Emails Sent to Capital Region Schools (Colonie Police Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Information Regarding Threatening Emails Sent to Capital Region Schools (Colonie Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I hereby request copies of the threatening emails received by the North Colonie Central School District, Watervliet City School District, and Green Island Union Free School District, as reported in the news article published by the Times Union on March 6, 2023, titled "Some Capital Region schools received nationally sent email threat Monday" (https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/capital-region-schools-received-nationally-sent-17822662.php) 

Additionally, I request copies of any police reports, witness statements, and/or narratives submitted by police officers related to the threatening emails. Please also provide any correspondence between the school districts and law enforcement agencies related to the emails.

As a reminder, FOIL requires that requests for records be granted or denied within five business days of receipt of a request. If access to any records is denied, please provide a written response detailing the reasons for denial.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Arthur Trudeau

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Arthur Trudeau
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning Arthur Gilbert Trudeau (July 5, 1902 – June 5, 1991), a lieutenant general in the United States Army. As he was born over 100 years ago, proof of death is not required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: Bobber

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bobber
communications.communication:
Dear Army Corps of Engineers:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to USACE's water safety mascot, Bobber. These would include (but are not limited to) (1) all records related to the conception and development of the "Bobber" costume or character; (2) any guidelines or guidance related to the use of the Bobber costume or character; (3) any Bobber-related contracts; (4) any records featuring or mentioning Bobber; and (5) any communications or correspondence related to Bobber.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free via muckrock.com, a FOIA journalism site. This request is part of the Federal Agency Mascot Project. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I respectfully request that any fees associated with this request please be waived.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that responsive records be produced to me electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or by CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you very much, and I look forward to your response within 20 business days.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Nicholas Marritz FOIA Request - FP-22-004070 - Request for Additional Information (Bobber)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Marritz,

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated November 16, 2021 for all records related to USACE's water safety mascot, Bobber, including but not limited to: (1) all records related to the conception and development of the "Bobber" costume or character; (2) any guidelines or guidance related to the use of the Bobber costume or character; (3) any Bobber-related contracts; (4) any records featuring or mentioning Bobber; and (5) any communications or correspondence related to Bobber. Your request has been assigned tracking number FP-22-004070.

Please be advised this office is not a repository for documents. Therefore, we must determine where the information you have requested would be located and request a document search be conducted by the relevant records custodians.

We are unable to process your request at this time. Please be advised that your request, as submitted, is not perfected. It does not reasonably describe the records sought, as required by 5 U.S.C. § 552. Please note that, pursuant to 32 C.F.R. § 286.5, FOIA requests must describe the documents requested in sufficient detail to allow the FOIA Office to locate them with a reasonable amount of effort. Additionally, the FOIA does not require agencies to create records in response to FOIA requests.


We reached out to our National Water Safety Program Manager, who will need additional information in order to search for documents. Please note that Bobber has been the USACE National Water Safety Mascot for several years and is used agency‑wide, so it would be impossible to provide the number of times Bobber has been mentioned and/or featured in USACE materials.


More specificity would be helpful. (1) Are you willing to narrow the scope of your request to include specific USACE districts or locations? (2) You provide a very broad list of categories for the types of documents and records you seek; however, what documents or records are most relevant to the information you need for your specific purpose? (3) Please provide a specific timeframe?

Please reply to this message by narrowing the scope of your request to more reasonably describe the records you seek. Any details you can provide will be helpful.

Your request file will remain open for 10 business days while we await your response. If no response is received by February 2, 2022, we will assume you are no longer interested and will close your request.

Best regards,

Mary Alice Smith
Paralegal Specialist
U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
HECSA - Office of Counsel
7701 Telegraph Road
Alexandria, VA  22315
703-428-8160 (office)
703-428-7221 (fax)
Mary.A.Smith@usace.army.mil

THIS IS A PRIVILEGED COMMUNICATION -ATTORNEY-CLIENT/ATTORNEY WORK-PRODUCT. DO NOT RELEASE UNDER FOIA.

NOTICE:  This email and any attachments constitute non-public information
and may contain legally privileged and confidential information intended
solely for the use of the addressee(s).  If you are not the intended
recipient, any reading, dissemination, distribution, copying or other use of
this email, including attachments, is prohibited and may be unlawful.  If
you have received this message in error, please delete it, including all
copies and backups, and notify me immediately by telephone at (703) 428‑8160
or by email at Mary.A.Smith@usace.army.mil. Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bobber
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Smith:

Thank you for your response. I am happy to narrow the scope of this request. I am seeking records sufficient to answer the following questions: 

(1) Whose idea was it to have a water safety mascot in the first place, and what was the thought process behind that?
(2) Who designed the mascot, and what was the design process like (e.g. were there multiple design concepts submitted? Was the design of the character contracted out? (If so, kindly produce the contract).
(3) When and how were the other characters in what I'm going to call the "Bobber Extended Universe" created? (e.g. Ranger Buck, Ranger Jane, Ranger Toro, Tackle, Jacques Catsto, Corkey, Sinker)
(4) Were any Bobber-related promotional items or tchotchkes created (e.g trading cards, coloring books)? If so, please produce them.
(5) Were there any life-size Bobber costumes created? If so, please produce records related to the design of the costume (contracts, sketches, etc.) and any guidelines regarding the use of or care for the costume.
(6) Did anyone in Congress ever object to USCA's use of a mascot? I understand that there have been periodic attempts by lawmakers (e.g. former Oklahoma senator Tom Coburn) to rein in agency spending on mascots. If so, please produce all records related to that.

Please let me know if this is sufficient information to enable your search.

With best regards,

Nicholas Marritz
